./

dat_data.pro


Routines

top source dat_data

NV/SYS

result = dat_data(dd, samples=samples, offset=offset, nd=nd, true=true, noevent=noevent, abscissa=abscissa)

Returns the data array associated with a data descriptor.

Return value

The data array associated with the data descriptor. STATUS: Complete SEE ALSO: dat_set_data

Parameters

dd in

Data descriptor.

Keywords

samples in

Sampling indices. If set, only these data elements are returned. May be 1D or the same number of dimensions as the data array.

offset
nd in

If set, the samples input is taken to be an ND coordinate rather than a 1D subscript. dat_data can normally tell the difference automatically, but there is an ambiguity if a single ND point is requested. In that case, dat_data interprets that as an array of 1D subscripts, unless /nd is set.

true in

If set, the actual data array is returned, even if there is a sampling function.

noevent
abscissa in

If set, the abscissa array is returned instead of the data array.

Author information

History:

Written by: Spitale, 2/1998 Adapted by: Spitale, 5/2016
